term_definitions.items: Peak systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The position of the individual at the time of measurement.
The size of the cuff used for blood pressure measurement.
Perloff D, Grim C, Flack J, Frohlich ED, Hill M, McDonald M, Morgenstern BZ. Human blood pressure determination by sphygmomanometry. Circulation 1993;88;2460-2470.
Simple body site where blood pressure was measured.
A cuff used for an adult thigh.
A cuff for adults with larger arms.
A cuff that is standard for an adult.
The right arm of the person.
The left arm of the person.
The right thigh of the person.
The left thigh of the person.
Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.
Standing at the time of blood pressure measurement.
Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of blood pressure measurement.
Reclining at the time of blood pressure measurement.
Lying flat at the time of blood pressure measurement.
The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the time of measurement.
The average arterial pressure that occurs over the entire course of the heart contraction and relaxation cycle.
The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.
A cuff used for a small adult.
A cuff that is appropriate for a child or adult with a thin arm.
Record which Korotkoff sound is used for determining diastolic pressure using auscultative method.
The fourth Korotkoff sound is identified as an abrupt muffling of sounds.
The fifth Korotkoff sound is identified by absence of sounds as the cuff pressure drops below the diastolic blood pressure.
Lying flat with some lateral tilt, usually angled towards the left side. Commonly required in the last trimester of pregnancy to relieve aortocaval compression.
A cuff used for a neonate, assuming cuff is the appropriate size for maturity and birthweight of the neonate.
The right wrist of the individual.
The left wrist of the individual.
Details about sphygmomanometer or other device used to measure the blood pressure.
The right ankle of the individual.
Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of blood pressure measurement.
The left ankle of the individual.
Method of measurement of blood pressure.
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a stethoscope and Korotkoff sounds.
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using palpation (usually of the brachial or radial arteries).
Formula used to calculate the Mean Arterial Pressure (if recorded in data).
Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a blood pressure machine.
Method of measuring blood pressure internally ie involving penetration of the skin and measuring inside blood vessels.
Estimate of the average blood pressure over a 24 hour period.
Sleep status - supports interpretation of 24 hour ambulatory blood pressure records.
The individual is in the natural state of bodily rest.

Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the blood pressure measurement. For example, level of anxiety or 'white coat syndrome'; pain or fever; changes in atmospheric pressure etc.
Invasive measurement via transducer access line within an artery.
Formula used to calculate the systolic pressure from from mean arterial pressure (if recorded in data).
Formula used to calculate the diastolic pressure from mean arterial pressure (if recorded in data).
Structured anatomical location of where the measurement was taken.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the blood pressure measurement.
The individual's dorsum of the foot.
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.
Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Simple description about the site of measurement.
Temperature is measured within the mouth.
Temperature is measured from within the external auditory canal.
Temperature is measured from the skin of the axilla with the arm positioned down by the side.
Temperature is measured within the nasopharynx.
Temperature is measured in the urinary bladder.
Temperature is measured within the vascular system.
The degree of exposure of the individual at the time of measurement.
The person is covered by a lesser amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.
The person is covered by an amount of clothing or bedding deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.
The person is covered by an increased amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances.
Narrative description of the conditions applied to the subject that might influence their measured body temperature.
Temperature is measured from exposed skin.
Temperature is measured within the vagina.
Temperatue is measured within the oesophagus.
Temperature is measured in the inguinal skin crease between the leg and abdominal wall.
Details about the environmental conditions at the time of temperature measurement.
Details about the exertion of the person at the time of temperature measurement.
Details about the device used to measure body temperature.
Temperature is measured at the temple, over the superficial temporal artery.
Temperature is measured on the forehead.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
Additional comment about the body temperature measurement not captured in other fields.
Structured details about the location of measurement.
Current day of the menstrual cycle.
The first day of menstruation is considered to be Day 1 of each menstrual cycle.
Additional issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body temperature, not captured in other fields.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the core body temperature of the individual.
Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.
Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.

Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.

If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.
Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.
Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.
Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.

Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.

Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.

Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.
If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.
Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.

May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.
Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.

Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.
The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.
The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.
The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.
Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.
The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.
The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.
If an alternative valueset is required, these values can be added to the DV_TEXT data type in a template.
The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.
The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.
The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.
Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.
Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
A cause, set of causes, or manner of causation of the problem or diagnosis.
Also known as 'aetiology' or 'etiology'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.
Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.

Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).

items.items: *Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)

Informacin adicional requerida para representar el contexto local o para alineamiento con otros modelos de referencia y formalismos.
Ej.: Informacin local del departamento hospitalario o metadatos adicionales para alineamiento con los equivalentes en FHIR o CIMI.
Interaccin, contacto o evento de cuidados entre un sujeto de cuidados y uno o ms proveedores de cuidados de la salud.
Informaes adicionais necessrias para identificar contexto local ou alinhar com outros formalismos/modelos de referncia.
Por exemplo: informao departamental local de hospital ou metadados adicionais para alinhar com equivalentes FHIR ou CIMI.
Interao, contato ou cuidado entre o sujeito do cuidado e profissional(is) de sade.

Aanvullende informatie die vereist is om de lokale context vast te leggen of in lijn te brengen met andere referentie-modellen/formalismen.
Bijvoorbeeld lokale ziekenhuisafdeling informatie of aanvullende metadata om uit in lijn te brengen met FHIR of CIMI-equivalenten.
Interactie, contact of zorggebeurtenis tussen een onderwerp van zorg en zorgverlener(s).
Extra information som krvs fr att fnga lokal kontext eller fr anpassning till andra referensmodeller och formalismer.
Exempelvis information om en lokal sjukhusavdelning eller ytterligare metadata fr anpassning till FHIR- eller CIMI-motsvarigheter.
Interaktion, kontakt eller vrdhndelse mellan vrdtagare och vrdgivare inom hlso- och sjukvrden.
Zustzliche Informationen, zur Erfassung lokaler Inhalte oder Anpassung an andere Referenzmodelle / Formalismen.
Zum Beispiel Informationen zu lokalen Krankenhausabteilungen oder zustzliche Metadaten zur bereinstimmung mit FHIR- oder CIMI-quivalenten.
Interaktion, Kontakt oder Versorgungsereignis, zwischen einem Versorgungsempfnger und einem Gesundheitsdienstleister.

Un manguito usado para el muslo del adulto - cmara de caucho aproximadamente de 20cm x 42 cm
Un manguito para adultos con brazos mas grandes - cmara de caucho aproximadamente de 16cm x 38cm.
Un manguito estndar para adulto - cmara de caucho approximadamente de 13cm x 30cm.
*Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.(en)
De pie al momento de la medicin de la tensin arterial.
Sentado (en la cama o en una silla) durante el registro de la presin arterial
Reclinado (semisentado) durante el registro de la presin arterial
Acostado horizontal durante la medicin de la presin arterial
*The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the time of measurement.(en)
*PLEASE NOTE: '' is a valid UCUM unit. Please use 'deg' as the correct unit.(en)
La presin arterial promedio que ocurre durante el ciclo entero de la contraccin y relajacin del corazon
La diferencia entre la presin sistlica y la presin diastlica
Un manguito usado para adulto pequeo - cmara de caucho approximadamente de 10cm x 24cm.
Un manguito que es apropiado para un nio o un adulto con brazos delgados - cmara de caucho approximadamente 8cm x 21cm.
Registro usando los sonidos de Korotkoff para determinar la presin diastlica
El cuarto sonido de Korotkoff se identifica como una abrupta amortiguacin de sonidos.
El quinto sonido de Korotkoff se identifica como la ausencia de sonidos a medida que la presin del manguito insuflado cae por debajo de la presin arterial diastlica.
Acostado e inclinado levemente sobre su costado izquierdo
Acostado horizontal e inclinado levemente sobre su costado izquierdo. Comnmente se requiere durante el ltimo trimestre del embarazo para aliviar la compresin aortocava.
Un manguito usado para infantes - cmara de caucho approximadamente de 5cm x 15cm.
Un manguito usado para neonatos, asumiendo que es del tamao adecuado para la madurez y el peso corporal del neonato.
Detalles del esfingomanmetro u otro dispositivo usado para medir la presin arterial.
Detalles de la actividad fsica realizados durante la medicin de la presin arterial
Mtodo de la medicin de la presin arterial
Mtodo de la medicin de la presin arterial externa, usando un estetoscopio y los sonidos de Korotkoff
Mtodo de medicin de la presin arterial externa, usando palpacin (normalmente de la arteria humeral o radial).
Frmula de la Presin Arterial Media (PAM)
Frmula usada para calcular la PAM (si se registra en el campo data)
Mtodo de medicin de la presin arterial externa, utilizando un monitor automtico (mecnico) de presin arterial
Mtodo de medicin de la presin arterial interna o sea invasiva: puncin de la piel y la introduccin de un cateter para medir dentro de un vaso sanguneo.
Estimativo de la media de la presin arterial sobre un perodo de 24 horas
Estado del sueo - soporta la interpretacin de los registros de presin arterial ambulatorios de 24 horas
El sujeto esta en un estado natural de sueo corporal

Comentario y registro sobre otros factores que pueden incidir sobre la medicin de la presin arterial. Por ejemplo: nivel de ansiedad o "sndrome del guardapolvo blanco"; dolor o fiebre; cambios en la presin atmosfrica etc.

*Formula used to calculate the diastolic pressure from mean arterial pressure (if recorded in data).(en)

La medicin local de la tensin arterial que deriva de la medida de la presin arterial en la circulacin sistmica. Comnmente el uso de 'presin arterial' se refiere a la medida de la presin de la arteria braquial por encima del pliegue del codo.
Presso arterial sistmica mxima - medida na fase sistlica ou de contrao do ciclo cardaco.
Presso arterial sistmica mnima - medida na fase diastlica ou de dilatao do ciclo cardaco.
Padro, ponto especificado no tempo ou evento de intervalo que pode ser explicitamente definido em um modelo ou em tempo de execuo.
A posio do sujeito na hora da medida.
Tamanho da braadeira usada para medir a presso arterial.
Local do corpo simples em que a presso arterial foi medida.
Uma braadeira usada na coxa de um aduto - manguito de aproximadamente 20cm x 42cm.
Uma braadeira para adultos com brao largo - manguito de aproximadamente 16cm x 38cm.
Uma braadeira padro para adultos - manguito de aproximadamente 13cm x 30cm.
Narrativa adicional sobre a medio, no capturada em outros campos.
Em p na hora da medida da presso arterial.
Sentado (por exemplo na cama ou em uma cadeira) na hora da medida da presso arterial.
Reclinado na hora da medida da presso arterial.
Deitado sem reclinao hora da medida da presso arterial.
A inclinao craniocaudal da superfcie na qual a pessoa est deitada no momento da medio.
* ATENO: '' uma unidade UCUM vlida. Por favor, use 'graus' como a unidade correta.
A presso arterial mdia que ocorrre ao longo de todo o ciclo de contrao e dilatao do corao.
A diferena entre a presso sistlica e diastlica.
Uma braadeira usada para adultos pequenos -manguito de aproximadamente 10cm x 24cm.
Manguito apropriao para uma criana ou um adulto com um brao fino - bolsa de aproximadamente 8cm x 21cm.
Registro do som Korotkoff usado para determinar a presso arterial diastlica, usando o mtodo auscultativo.
O quarto som de Korotkoff identificado como um sbito abafamento dos sons.
O quinto som de Korotkoff identificado pela ausncia de sons, pois a presso da braadeira cai abaixo da presso diastlica do sangue.
Deitado sem reclinao com alguma inclinao lateral, usualmente com angulao para o lado esquerdo. Comumente requerido no ltimo trimestre da gravidez para aliviar a compresso aortocaval.
Uma braadeira utilizada em crianas pequenas - manguito de aproximadamente 5cm x 15cm.
Uma braadeira usada para um recm-nascido, supondo que o tamanho apropriado para a maturidade e o peso ao nascer do neonato.
Detalhes sobre o esfigmomanmetro ou outro aparelho utilizado para medir a presso sangunea.
Detalhes sobre atividade fsica realizada na hora da medida da presso arterial.
Mtodo de medida da presso arterial.
Mtodo de medir a presso externamente, usando o estetoscpiso e os sons Korotkoff.
Mtodo de medir a presso arterial externamente, usando a palpao (geralmente artrias braquiais ou radiais).
Frmula usada para calcular a presso arterial mdia (PAM), se registrada em dados.
Mtodo de medir a presso arterial externamente, usando o aparelho de presso arterial.
Mtodo de medir a presso arterial internamente, isto , envolvendo a penetrao da pele e a medida interior dos vasos sanguneos.
Estimativa da presso arterial mdia em um perodo de 24 horas.
Status do sono - apia a interpretao do registro do mapa de presso arterial (ambulatorial de 24 horas).
Sujeito est no estado natural de descanso corporal.
Um dedo do p do indivduo.

Comentrios sobre e registros de outros fatores incidentais que possam estar contribuindo na medida da presso sangunea. Por exemplo, nvel de ansiedade ou "sndrome do jaleco branco"; dor ou febre; mudanas na presso atmosfrica, etc.
Medio invasiva via linha de acesso do transdutor dentro de uma artria.
Frmula utilizada para calcular a presso sistlica a partir da presso arterial mdia (se registrada nos dados).
Frmula utilizada para calcular a presso diastlica da presso arterial mdia (se registrada nos dados).
O dorso do p do indivduo.
Localizao anatmica estruturada de onde a medio foi feita.
Informaes adicionais necessrias para capturar o contexto local ou para alinhar com outros modelos / formalismos de referncia.
Por exemplo: Informaes locais de departamentos de hospitais ou metadados adicionais para alinhar a equivalentes FHIR ou CIMI
Palavra nica, frase ou breve descrio que representa o significado clnico e o significado da medida da presso arterial.

A medida local da presso sangunea arterial, a qual uma substituta da presso arterial na circulao arterial sistmica. Mais comumente o uso do termo presso arterial se refere medida da presso da artria braquial no antebrao.

Om te registreren welk Korotkoff geluid gebruikt is om de diastolische druk te meten door de auscultatieve methode.

Platliggend met enige laterale kanteling, meestal gekanteld naar de linkerzijde. Gebruikelijk benodigd in het laatste trimester van de zwangerschap om aortacavale compressie te verlichten.
Een manchet voor een neonaat, er van uitgaande dat de manchet de juiste maat is voor volgroeidheid en geboortegewicht van de neonaat.

Opmerking over en vastleggen van andere incidentele factoren die de bloeddrukmeting zouden kunnen benvloeden. Bijvoorbeeld, mate van angst, of 'witte jas syndroom'; pijn of koorts; veranderingen in atmosferische druk etc.
Invasieve meting via een druktransducer in de arterielijn.

Formule om de diastolische druk van de MAP (mean arterial pressure=gemiddelde arterile druk) te berekenen (als deze data opgeslagen wordt).

De lokale meting van de arterile bloeddruk, welke surrogaat is voor de arterile druk in de systemische circulatie.

En manschett som anvnds till sm vuxna.

Liggande i platt stllning med viss lateral lutning, vanligtvis mot vnster sida. Den krvs vanligtvis i graviditetens sista trimester fr att lindra aortokaval kompression.

Andra faktorer som kan pverka blodtrycksmtningen, exempelvis ngestniv, "vitrockseffekt", smrta, feber eller frndringar i lufttryck mm.

Formel som anvnds fr att berkna det diastoliska trycket frn medelartrtrycket (om det finns registrerat).

Der minimale systemische arterielle Blutdruck eines Zyklus - gemessen in der diastolischen oder Entspannungsphase des Herzens.

Eine Manschette fr Neugeborene mit passender Gre fr die Reife und das Geburtsgewicht des Neugeborenen.

Kommentar til og registrering av andre faktorer som kan pvirke blodtrykksmlingen. For eksempel angst eller "hvit frakk syndrom", smerter eller feber, endringer i atmosfrisk trykk osv.

*Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
*Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support.(en)
*An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.(en)
*Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support.(en)
*A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.
If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.(en)
*Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.(en)

*May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.(en)
*Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.(en)

*Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity.(en)
*Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.(en)
*The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.(en)
*The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)
*If an alternative valueset is required, these values can be added to the DV_TEXT data type in a template.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.(en)
*A cause, set of causes, or manner of causation of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Also known as 'aetiology' or 'etiology'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)

*Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)
Identificacin del problema o diagnstico, por nombre.
Se prefiere la codificacin del nombre del problema o diagnstico mediante una terminologa cuando esto sea posible.
Fecha y hora del reconocimiento clnico
Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales el diagnstico o problema fue reconocido por el profesional de la salud.

El uso de fechas parciales es aceptable. Si el sujeto de cuidados tiene menos de un ao de edad, se requiere la fecha completa o al menos el ao y mes para permitir clculos adecuados (si por ejemplo se utiliza para guiar un apoyo a la toma de decisiones). Los datos registrados o importados como "Edad a la aparicin" debern ser convertidos a una fecha utilizando la fecha de nacimiento del sujeto.
Una evaluacin de la severidad general del problema o diagnstico.

Si la severidad del problema o diagnstico esta incluida en su nombre mediante cdigos precoordinados, este dato se torna redundante. Nota: una gradacin ,as especfica de severidad puede ser registrada utilizando el slot de Detalles especficos.
Descripcin narrativa del problema o diagnstico.
Utilizar para proveer trasfondo y contexto, incluyendo evolucin, episodios o exacerbaciones, progreso y cualquier otro detalles relevante acerca del problema o diagnstico.
Identificacin de un sitio corporal simple para la localizacin o el problema.

Se prefiere la codificacin de la localizacin anatmica mediante una terminologa cuando esto sea posible. Utilcese este dato para registrar localizaciones anatmicas precoordinadas. Si los requerimientos para el registro de una localizacin anatmica son determinadas en tiempo de ejecucin por parte de la aplicacin, o se requiere un modelado ms complejo tal como una localizacin relativa, utilcese CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location dentro del slot "localizacin anatmica estructurada" en este arquetipo. Las ocurrencias de este dato son ilimitadas para as permitir escenarios clnicos tales como la descripcin de un rash en mltiples localizaciones pero donde todos los dems atributos son idnticos. Si la localizacin anatmica esta incluida en el nombre del problema o diagnstico mediante cdigos precoordinados, este dato se torna redundante.
Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales este problema o diagnstico remiti o se resolvi, determinadas de un profesional de la salud.

El uso de fechas parciales es aceptable. Si el sujeto de cuidados tiene menos de un ao de edad, se requiere la fecha completa o al menos el ao y mes para permitir clculos adecuados (si por ejemplo se utiliza para guiar un apoyo a la toma de decisiones).
una localizacin anatmica estructurada para el problema o diagnstico.

Utilcese este slot para insertar los arqeutipos de CLUSTER.anatomical_location o CLUSTER.relative_location si los requerimientos de registro de la localizacin anatmica son determinados en tiempo de ejecucin por la aplicacin o se requiere un modelado ms complejo tal como localizaciones relativas. Si la localizacin anatmica est incluida en el nombre del problema o diagnstico mediante cdigos precoordinados, este dato se torna redundante.
Detalles adicionales requeridos para registrar como atributos unvocos del este problema o diagnstico.

Puede incluir detalles estructurados acerca del grado o estadificacin del diagnstico, criterios diagnsticos, criterios de clasificacin o una evaluacin formal de severidad tal como los Criterios Terminolgicos Comunes para Eventos Adversos.
Detalles estructurados para los aspectos especficos de localizacin, dominio, episodio o decurso del proceso diagnstico.

Los calificadores de estado o contexto con cuidado ya que son variables en su utilizacin y la interoperabilidad no puede ser garantizada excepto en casos en que se encuentren claramente definidos en el seno de la comunidad de uso. Por ejemplo, el estado de actividad (activo, inactivo, resuelto o en remisin), el estado de evolucin (inicial, interino o de trabajo, final), el estado temporal (actual, pasado), el estado episdico (primero, inicial, en curso), el estado de admisin (admisin, egreso) o el estado de prioridad (primario, secundario).
El problema o diagnstico no interfiere con la actividad normal o puede causar daos a la salud si no es tratado.
El problema o diagnstico interfiere con la actividad normal o puede daar la salud si no es tratado.
El problema o diagnstico impide la actividad normal o pude daar seriamente la salud si no es tratado.
Narrativa adicional acerca del problema o diagnstico que no ha sido consignada en otros campos.
La fecha de la ltima actualizacin de este problema o diagnstico.
Informacin adicional requerida para consignar contenidos locales o alinear con otros modelos de referencia o formalismos.
Por ejemplo: requerimientos de informacin local o metadatos adicionales para alineamiento con equivalentes en FHIR o CIMI.
Descripcin narrativa del curso del problema o diagnstico desde su aparicin.
El nivel de certeza de la identificacin del diagnstico.

El diagnstico ha sido identificado con un bajo nivel de certeza.
El diagnstico ha sido identificado con un alto nivel de certeza.
El diagnstico ha sido confirmado en base a criterios reconocidos.
Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales los signos o sntomas del problema fueron observados por primera vez.
Los datos registrados o importados como "Edad a la aparicin" debern ser convertidos a una fecha utilizando la fecha de nacimiento del sujeto.
*A cause, set of causes, or manner of causation of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Also known as 'aetiology' or 'etiology'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
Detalles acerca de una condicin de salud, lesin, incapacidad o cualquier otra cuerstin, univocamente identificadas, que impacta sobre el bienestar fsico, mental y/o social de un individuo

La delineacin entre el alcance de un problema versus el diagnstico puede no ser fcil de lograr en la prctica. A los fines de la documentacin clnica mediante este arquetipo, problema y diagnstico son considerados un continuo, donde niveles incrementales de detalles y evidencia de apoyo otorgan mas peso a la etiqueta de "diagnstico".
Identificao do problema ou diagnstico, por nome.
Quando possvel, prefervel usar a codificao do nome do problema ou diagnstico com uma terminologia.
Data / hora, estimada ou real, que o diagnstico ou o problema foi reconhecido por um profissional de sade.

Datas parciais so aceitveis. Se o tema do cuidado est com idade inferior a um ano, ento a data completa ou no mnimo o ms e o ano so necessrios para permitir clculos de idade precisos, por exemplo, se usado para conduzir apoio deciso. Os dados capturados / importados como "Idade no momento do reconhecimento clnico" deve ser convertida para uma data usando o sujeito data de nascimento.
Uma avaliao global da severidade do problema ou diagnstico.

Se a severidade est includa no nome do Problema / diagnstico atravs de cdigos pr-coordenados, este elemento de dados torna-se redundante. Nota: a classificao mais especfica da gravidade pode ser gravada utilizando os detalhes especficos SLOT.
Descrio narrativa sobre o problema ou diagnstico.
Usar para fornecer conhecimento e contexto, incluindo evoluo, episdios ou exacerbaes, progresso e quaisquer outros detalhes relevantes, sobre o problema ou diagnstico.
Simples identificao de um local do corpo para a localizao do problema ou diagnstico.

A codificao do nome da localizao anatmica com uma terminologia prefervel, quando possvel. Utilize este elemento de dados para gravar localizaes anatmicas precoordenadas. Se os requisitos para gravar a localizao anatmica so determinados em tempo real atravs da aplicao ou requerem uma modelagem mais complexa, como localizaes relativas, em seguida, use o CLUSTER.anatomical_location ou CLUSTER.relative_location dentro do SLOT 'localizao anatmica estruturada' neste arqutipo. Ocorrncias para este elemento de dados so ilimitadas para permitir cenrios clnicos tais como a descrio de uma erupo cutnea em vrios locais, mas em que todos os outros atributos so idnticos. Se a localizao anatmica includa ao nome do Problema / diagnstico, atravs de cdigos pr-coordenados, este elemento de dados torna-se redundante.
Data / tempo, estimado ou atual, de resoluo ou de dispensa desse problema ou diagnstico, como determinado por um profissional de sade.

Datas parciais so aceitveis. Se o tema do cuidado est com idade inferior a um ano, ento a data completa ou no mnimo o ms e o ano so necessrios para permitir clculos de idade precisos, por exemplo, se usado para conduzir apoio deciso. Os dados capturados / importados como "Idade na ocasio da resoluo" deve ser convertida para uma data usando o sujeito data de nascimento.
A localizao anatmica estruturada para o problema ou diagnstico.

Use esse SLOT para inserir os arqutipos CLUSTER.anatomical_location ou CLUSTER.relative_location se os requisitos para gravar a localizao anatmica so determinados em tempo real atravs da aplicao ou requer uma modelagem mais complexa, como localizaes relativas.
Se a localizao anatmica est includa ao nome Problema / diagnstico, atravs de cdigos pr-coordenados, o uso deste SLOT torna-se redundante.
Detalhes que so adicionalmente necessrios para gravar atributos como nicos deste problema ou diagnstico.

Pode incluir detalhes estruturados sobre a classificao ou a realizao do diagnstico; critrios de diagnstico, critrios de classificao ou avaliao formal da severidade, como os critrios de terminologia comum para eventos adversos.
Detalhes estruturados para localizao, domnio, episdio ou aspectos especficos do fluxo de trabalho do processo de diagnstico.

Use o estado ou os qualificadores contexto com cuidado, pois eles so variveis quando usados na prtica e a interoperabilidade no pode ser assegurada, salvo se o uso est claramente definido com a comunidade de uso. Por exemplo: evoluo do estado: inicial, inativo, resolvido, em remisso; estado de evoluo: inicial, provisrio / trabalhando, final; estado temporal: presente, passado; estado do episodio: primeiro, novo, em curso; estado de admisso: admisso, alta; ou estado de prioridade: primrio, secundrio.

O problema ou o diagnstico interfere na atividade normal ou prejudicar a sade, se no for tratado.
O problema ou diagnstico impede a atividade normal ou causar srios danos sade se no tratado.
Narrativa adicional sobre o problema ou diagnstico, no capturados em outros campos.
A data este problema ou diagnstico foi atualizado pela ltima vez.
Informaes adicionais necessrias para capturar o contedo local ou para alinhar com outros modelos de referncia / formalismos.
Por exemplo: requisitos de informao locais ou metadados adicionais para alinhar com FHIR ou CIMI equivalentes.
Descrio narrativa sobre o curso do problema ou diagnstico, desde o incio.

Delimitao clara entre o mbito de um problema em comparao a um diagnstico, no fcil de se conseguir na prtica. *Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. Det r inte ltt att i praktiken uppn en tydlig avgrnsning mellan ett problem och en diagnos. Vid tillmpning av klinisk dokumentation med denna arketyp betraktas problem och diagnos som ett kontinuum, med plats fr fler detaljer och stdjande bevis som vanligtvis ger tyngd till etiketten diagnos.
Namentliche Identifikation des Problems oder der Diagnose.
Wo mglich, ist die Kodierung des Problems oder der Diagnose ber eine Terminologie zu bevorzugen.
Geschtzte oder exakte Zeit (bzw. Datum), zu der die Diagnose oder das Problem von einer medizinischen Fachkraft festgestellt wurde.

Unvollstndige Datumsangaben sind zulssig. Wenn der Patient unter einem Jahr alt ist, dann ist das vollstndige Datum oder ein Minimum von Monat und Jahr notwendig, um genaue Altersberechnungen zu ermglichen - z.B. wenn es zur Entscheidungsuntersttzung verwendet wird. Datumswerte, die als "Alter zum Zeitpunkt der klinischen Feststellung" erfasst/importiert werden, sollten anhand des Geburtsdatums der Person in ein Datum umgewandelt werden.
Eine Gesamtbeurteilung des Schweregrades des Problems oder der Diagnose.

Ist der Schweregrad ber vordefinierte Codes im Element "Name des Problems/ der Diagnose" enthalten, wird dieses Datenelement berflssig. Hinweis: Eine spezifischere Einstufung des Schweregrads kann mit Hilfe des SLOTs "Spezifische Angaben" angegeben werden.
Beschreibung des Problems oder der Diagnose.
Wird verwendet, um Hintergrund und Kontext, einschlielich Entwicklung, Episoden oder Verschlechterungen, Fortschritt und andere relevante Details ber das Problem oder die Diagnose zu liefern.
Identifikation einer einfachen Krperstelle zur Lokalisierung des Problems oder der Diagnose.

Wo dies mglich ist, ist die Kodierung der anatomischen Lokalisation ber eine Terminologie zu bevorzugen. Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um vorab prkoordinierte anatomische Lokalisationen zu erfassen. Wenn die Anforderungen an die Erfassung der anatomischen Lokalisation zur Laufzeit durch die Anwendung bestimmt werden oder komplexere Modellierungen, wie z.B. relative Lokalisationen erforderlich sind, dann verwenden Sie in diesem Archetyp den CLUSTER.anatomical_location oder CLUSTER.relative_location innerhalb des SLOT 'Structured anatomical location'. Die Anzahl fr dieses Datenelement ist unbegrenzt, um klinische Szenarien wie die Beschreibung eines Hautausschlags an mehreren Stellen zu ermglichen, wobei jedoch alle anderen Attribute identisch sind. Falls die anatomische Lage ber prkoordinierte Codes im Namen des Problems/Diagnose enthalten ist, wird dieses Datenelement berflssig.
Geschtzte oder exakte Zeit (bzw. Datum), zu der von einer medizinischen Fachkraft die Genesung oder die Remission des Problems oder der Diagnose festgestellt wurde.

Unvollstndige Datumsangaben sind zulssig. Wenn der Patient unter einem Jahr alt ist, dann ist das vollstndige Datum oder ein Minimum von Monat und Jahr notwendig, um genaue Altersberechnungen zu ermglichen - z.B. wenn es zur Entscheidungsuntersttzung verwendet wird. Datumswerte, die als "Alter zum Zeitpunkt der Genesung" erfasst/importiert werden, sollten anhand des Geburtsdatums der Person in ein Datum umgewandelt werden.
Eine strukturierte anatomische Lokalisation des Problems oder der Diagnose.

Verwenden Sie diesen SLOT, um die Archetypen CLUSTER.anatomical_location oder CLUSTER.relative_location einzufgen, wenn die Anforderungen fr die Aufnahme der anatomischen Position zur Laufzeit der Anwendung bestimmt werden oder komplexere Modellierungen wie z.B. relative Positionen erforderlich sind. Ist die anatomische Lokalisation ber prkoordinierte Codes im Namen des Problems/Diagnose enthalten, wird die Verwendung dieses SLOT berflssig.
Zustzlich bentigte Angaben, welche als eindeutige Merkmale des Problem/der Diagnose erfasst werden sollten.

Hier knnen strukturierte Angaben ber die Einstufung oder das Stadium der Diagnose enthalten sein; diagnostische Kriterien, Klassifizierungskriterien oder formale Bewertungen des Schweregrades wie z.B. "Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events".
Strukturierte Angaben zu standort-, domnen-, episoden- oder workflow-spezifischen Aspekten des diagnostischen Prozesses.

Verwenden Sie Status- oder Kontext-Merkmale mit Vorsicht, da sie in der Praxis variabel eingesetzt werden und die Interoperabilitt nicht gewhrleistet werden kann, sofern die Verwendung nicht mit der Nutzungsgemeinschaft klar abgestimmt wird. Beispiel: aktiver Status - aktiv, inaktiv, genesen, in Remission; Entwicklungsstatus - initial, interim/working, final; zeitlicher Status - aktuell, vergangen; Episodenstatus - erstmalig, neu, laufend; Aufnahmestatus - Aufnahme, Entlassung; oder Priorittsstatus - primr, sekundr.
Das Problem oder die Diagnose beeintrchtigt die normale Aktivitt nicht, bzw. verursacht nicht bleibende gesundheitliche Schden, falls es nicht behandelt wird.
Das Problem oder die Diagnose beeintrchtigt die normale Aktivitt oder verursacht bleibende gesundheitliche Schden, falls es nicht behandelt wird.
Das Problem oder die Diagnose verhindert die normale Aktivitt oder verursacht schwerwiegende gesundheitliche Schden, falls es nicht behandelt wird.
Ergnzende Beschreibung des Problems oder der Diagnose, die nicht anderweitig erfasst wurde.
Datum der letzten Aktualisierung der Diagnose bzw. des Problems.
Zustzliche Informationen zur Erfassung lokaler Inhalte oder Anpassung an andere Referenzmodelle/Formalismen.
Zum Beispiel: Lokaler Informationsbedarf oder zustzliche Metadaten zur Anpassung an FHIR-Ressourcen oder CIMI-Modelle.
Beschreibung des Problem-/ Diagnoseverlaufs seit Beginn.
Grad der Sicherheit, mit der die Diagnose festgestellt wurde.
Wenn ein alternativer Wertesatz bentigt wird, knnen diese Werte in einem Template zum Datentyp DV_TEXT hinzugefgt werden.
Die Diagnose wurde mit einem niedrigen Grad an Sicherheit gestellt.
Die Diagnose wurde mit einem hohen Ma an Sicherheit gestellt.
Die Diagnose wurde anhand anerkannter Kriterien besttigt.
Datum/ Zeitpunkt des Auftretens/ der Erstdiagnose
Geschtzte oder exakte Zeit (bzw. Datum), zu der die Krankheitsanzeichen oder Symptome zum ersten mal beobachtet wurden.
Datumswerte, die als "Alter zu Beginn" erfasst/importiert werden, sollten anhand des Geburtsdatums der Person in ein Datum umgewandelt werden.
Die Ursache, eine Reihe von Ursachen oder eine Art und Weise der Verursachung des Problems oder der Diagnose.
Auch bekannt als tiologie. Die Codierung mit einer externen Terminologie wird nach Mglichkeit bevorzugt.

Angaben ber einen einzelnen identifizierten Gesundheitszustand, eine Verletzung, eine Behinderung oder ein Problem, welches das krperliche, geistige und/oder soziale Wohlergehen einer Einzelperson beeintrchtigt.

Eine klare Abgrenzung zwischen Problem und Diagnose ist in der Praxis nicht einfach zu erreichen. Fr die Zwecke der klinischen Dokumentation mit diesem Archetyp werden Problem und Diagnose als ein Kontinuum betrachtet, mit zunehmendem Detaillierungsgrad und untersttzenden Beweisen, die in der Regel dem Etikett "Diagnose" Gewicht verleihen.

*Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.(en)
Ongelma tai diagnoosi ei hiritse normaalia toimintaa tai voi aiheuttaa terveysvaurioita, jos sit ei hoideta.
Ongelma tai diagnoosi hiritsee normaalia toimintaa tai vahingoittaa terveytt, jos sit jtetn hoitamatta.
Ongelma tai diagnoosi est normaalia toimintaa tai vahingoittaa vakavasti terveytt, jos sit jtetn hoitamatta.
Listietoa ongelmasta tai diagnoosista, jota ei voi asettaa edeltville tietokentille.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
Kuvaus ongelman tai diagnoosin etenemisest alusta.
*If an alternative valueset is required, these values can be added to the DV_TEXT data type in a template.(en)
Diagnoosi on vahvistettu tunnustettujen kriteerien perusteella.
Arvioitu tai todellinen pivmr / aika, jolloin ongelman / diagnoosin merkkej tai oireita havaittiin ensimmisen kerran.
*Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*A cause, set of causes, or manner of causation of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Also known as 'aetiology' or 'etiology'. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
Yksityiskohdat yksittisest tunnistetusta terveystilasta, vammasta, vammasta tai muusta aiheesta, joka vaikuttaa yksiln fyysiseen, henkiseen ja / tai sosiaaliseen hyvinvointiin.

*Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)
Identifisering av problemet eller diagnosen ved hjelp av navn.
Koding av navnet p problemet eller diagnosen med en terminologi er foretrukket, der det er mulig.
Ansltt eller faktisk dato/tid da diagnosen eller problemet ble bekreftet av helsepersonell.

Delvise datoer er tillatt. Dersom individet er under ett r gammel, m komplett dato eller som et minimum mned og r oppgis for muliggjre presise beregninger av alder, f.eks. ved bruk i beslutningsstttesystemer. Data registrert eller importert som "alder ved tidspunkt nr diagnosen stilles" br konverteres til en dato ved hjelp av individets fdselsdato.
En vurdering av problemet eller diagnosens overordnede alvorlighetsgrad.

Dersom alvorlighetsgrad inkluderes i feltet "Problem/diagnosenavn" via prekoordinerte koder blir dette dataelementet overfldig. Merk: Mer spesifikk gradering av alvorlighetsgrad kan registreres ved bruke SLOTet "Spesifikke detaljer"
Brukes til gi bakgrunn og kontekst, inkludert utvikling, episoder eller forverringer, fremgang og alle andre relevante detaljer, om problemet eller diagnosen.
Registrering av et enkelt og usammensatt anatomisk sted der problemet eller diagnosen er lokalisert.

Koding av navnet p den anatomiske lokaliseringen ved hjelp av en terminologi er foretrukket nr dette er mulig. Bruk dette dataelementet for registrere prekoordinerte anatomiske lokaliseringer. Dersom behovene for registrere anatomisk sted bestemmes i applikasjonen eller trenger strre grad av kompleksitet som f.eks. relativ lokalisering, er det anbefalt bruke CLUSTER.anatomical_location eller CLUSTER.relative_location innenfor SLOTet "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisering" i denne arketypen. Dette dataelementet kan ha ubegrenset antall forekomster, for gjre det mulig registrere kliniske scenarier som f.eks. beskrive et utslett som opptrer flere steder p kroppen, men der alle andre attributter er identiske. Dersom den anatomiske lokaliseringen inkluderes i feltet "Problem/diagnosenavn" via prekoordinerte koder blir dette dataelementet overfldig.
Estimert eller faktisk dato/tid for bedring eller remisjon av det aktuelle problemet eller diagnosen, fastsltt av helsepersonell.

Delvise datoer er tillatt. Dersom individet er under ett r gammel, m komplett dato eller som et minimum mned og r oppgis for muliggjre presise beregninger av alder, f.eks. ved bruk i beslutningsstttesystemer. Data registrert eller importert som "alder ved bedring" br konverteres til en dato ved hjelp av individets fdselsdato.
SLOT som kan inneholde en eller flere detaljerte og strukturerte anatomiske lokaliseringer.

Dersom behovene for registrere anatomisk sted bestemmes i applikasjonen eller trenger strre grad av kompleksitet som f.eks. relativ lokalisering, er det anbefalt bruke CLUSTER.anatomical_location eller CLUSTER.relative_location i dette SLOTet.
Dersom den anatomiske lokaliseringen inkluderes i feltet "Problem/diagnosenavn" via prekoordinerte koder blir dette dataelementet overfldig.
Detaljer som er ndvendige for registrere det aktuelle problemet eller diagnosens unike egenskaper.

Kan omfatte strukturerte detaljer om klassifisering eller stadier av diagnosen; diagnosiske kriterier, klassifikasjon eller formelle vurderinger av alvorlighetsgrad, som f.eks. Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.
Strukturerte detaljer for lokalisering-, fagomrde-, episode- eller arbeidsflytsspesifikke aspekter av den diagnostiske prosessen.

Bruk status eller kontekstkvalifikatorer med omhu, da bruken varierer og interoperabilitet kan ikke garanteres med mindre bruken er klart definert innen miljet som bruker dem. F.eks. aktiv status - aktiv, inaktiv, lst, i bedring; utviklingsstatus - frste, midlertidig, endelig; tidsstatus - nvrende, tidligere; episodisk status - frste, ny, pgende; innleggelsesstatus - innleggelse, utskriving; eller prioritetsstatus - primr, sekundr.
Problemet eller diagnosen forstyrrer ikke normal aktivitet.
Problemet eller diagnosen forstyrrer normal aktivitet.
Problemet eller diagnosen forhindrer normal aktivitet.
Utdypende fritekst om problemet eller diagnosen, som ikke passer i andre felt.
Datoen da problemet eller diagnosen sist ble oppdatert.
Ytterligere informasjon som trengs for kunne registrere lokalt definert innhold eller for tilpasse til andre referansemodeller/formalismer.
For eksempel lokale informasjonsbehov eller ytterligere metadata for kunne tilpasse til tilsvarende konsepter i FHIR eller CIMI.
Fritekstbeskrivelse av forlpet av problemet eller diagnosen siden debut.
Grad av sikkerhet i identifikasjonen av diagnosen.
Hvis et alternativt verdisett er ndvendig, kan disse verdiene legges til DV_TEXT-datatypen i et templat.
Diagnoses er identifisert med en lav grad av sikkerhet.
Diagnosen er identifisert med en stor grad av sikkerhet.
Diagnosen er bekreftet opp mot anerkjente kriterier.
Antatt eller faktisk dato/tid da tegn eller symptomer p problemet eller diagnosen frst ble observert.
Data registrert eller importert som "alder ved debut" br konverteres til en dato ved hjelp av individets fdselsdato.
En rsak, kjede av rsaker til, eller hendelsesforlp forut for problemet eller diagnosen.
Ogs kjent som 'etiologi'. Det anbefales kode "rsak" med en ekstern terminologi dersom det er mulig.
Detaljer om n identifisert helsetilstand, skade, funksjonshemming eller annet forhold som pvirker et individs fysiske, mentale og/eller sosiale velvre.

Det er i praksis ikke lett oppn et klart skille mellom et problem og en diagnose. I klinisk dokumentasjon med denne arketypen ses problem og diagnose som et kontinuum, med kende krav til detaljer og stttende evidens for underbygge en diagnose.
